div.b: Shows I Really Like (at the moment):

content.div: Here's a sample about me section! But who am I? I'll figure this out later.

In this blog I'll post about things I find interesting, or cool stuff I've done lately. Maybe even movies or music I'm enjoying.
Things you might see in the future:
Programming Stuff
Math/Physics Stuff
Diary-style entries?
The making of this website
Things you'll hopefully never see in this blog:
Politics
Personal Problems
Purposefully Preposterous [P]Alliteration

Great question! I'm a fan of the classic Windows aesthetic. My first computer at home ran Windows XP, and at schools I used both XP and 98. The way they look really stuck with me and create a feeling of nostalgia that I hope visitors to my site feel as well. I liked tinkering with things as a kid, as well as the feeling of discovery. So I added a way to mess around with your mouse/pointer and the desktop color while you're here. There's some easter eggs littered here too, for anyone to discover and have fun with. Little things like these make me happy, and sometimes using the internet explorer logo as a cursor is enough to bring a smile to someone's face.
Since you've made it this far, here's one website that inspired me (warning, it's got catchy music):
Cache Monet

Full disclosure, you can drag the files on the desktop around too. And you can drag files in the folders. Just like on an actual Windows computer (click and hold + move mouse).
Only one catch: stuff inside folders can never be dragged outside, just like stuff on the desktop can't be dragged offscreen. Capisce?
